channel.title: Help with this client error?
channel.description:
I am using nightmare 317 source and client.
I can make the server run absolutely fine no issues,
However the client always returns
"error: could not find or load main class launcher"
Help is appreciated :)

item.title: Help with this client error?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your issue might be because of these lines:

cd . cd locandclass dir pause

Most of that shouldn’t even exist tbh.

And you should look into using environmental variables instead of declaring the java version in the command line like that: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/environment/paths.html

I believe a run.bat like this should work for you:

@echo off title Client cd ./locandclass/ "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

This one may work too, and if you have environmental variables I can guaranty it will:

@echo off title Client cd ./locandclass/ java -Xmx1024m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this client error?
item.dc:creator: @redcow789 redcow789
item.description:
@redcow789 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:553042”]A user at stack overflow has a great explanation on your error:

stackoverflow.com

Access to the path 'path-name' is denied (Xamarin.Android)

path, xamarin.android, access, denied
answered by Profile3ForStack on 09:22AM - 02 Mar 18

Thanks, gave me a big understanding on what the launch actually does!

But i still can’t find the reason it’s failing!

Edit:

I am using nightmare-scape source if that helps.

I have changed the run script and added the DIR command to make sure it is pointing to the right directory which i can tell you it is, for some reason it is just not finding “launcher.class” even though I have the following

@echo off
title Client
cd .
cd locandclass
dir
pause
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1024m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

locandclass is the directory where launcher.class is located

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this client error?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

A user at stack overflow has a great explanation on your error:

stackoverflow.com

What does "Could not find or load main class" mean?

java, class, main
asked by Stephen C on 03:02AM - 07 Aug 13

Read full topic
